body_html:
Note that the C API now elides copies when it is safe to do so (feeding doesn't copy, passing parameters to and returning values from py_func doesn't copy, and fetching only copies when fetching Variables and other persistent state).

Currently there is no API in tf for running op kernels directly on Tensors (this is tricky since the Tensors can be on non-cpu devices, which have contexts which need to be carefully set up). We could easily expose the CPU kernels.

Note that the C API now elides copies when it is safe to do so (feeding doesn't copy, passing parameters to and returning values from py_func doesn't copy, and fetching only copies when fetching Variables and other persistent state).
Currently there is no API in tf for running op kernels directly on Tensors (this is tricky since the Tensors can be on non-cpu devices, which have contexts which need to be carefully set up). We could easily expose the CPU kernels.
body:
Note that the C API now elides copies when it is safe to do so (feeding doesn't copy, passing parameters to and returning values from py_func doesn't copy, and fetching only copies when fetching Variables and other persistent state).

Currently there is no API in tf for running op kernels directly on Tensors (this is tricky since the Tensors can be on non-cpu devices, which have contexts which need to be carefully set up). We could easily expose the CPU kernels.
